turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling because I think there's a mistake on my bill. It seems higher than usual this month.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly help you with that. Could you please provide your account number so I can look into this for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, it's 123-456-7890. And honestly, I'm already a bit frustrated because I haven't changed my plan, and it's gone up by like $20!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. I'm looking at your account now. Hmm, it appears there was an additional charge for data usage. It seems you exceeded your monthly data allowance. The specific overage amount is 15GB. This caused an increase in the bill. I see this is a valid charge. Would you like me to explain the data overage charge in more detail?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wait a minute. My data usage? That's strange. I was on vacation last week and had very limited internet access. How can I prove I wasn't using that much data, especially when I wasn't even home? And even if I *did* use some extra data, how is it so expensive? Isn't there some sort of a 'grace period' or warning before charging that much?
